title: Skinny Sydney home only 2.5m wide up for sale
text:
Buyers looking to live life on the skinny side need to look no further than this Sydney terrace.

Measuring only 2.5m wide, this Enmore property is one of the skinniest properties to hit the market in Sydney.

The one-bedroom house at 19 London St in Enmore is due to go to auction at the end of the month and is described as a great opportunity for younger buyers looking to get into the market.

MORE: Balmain’s iconic Unity Hall Hotel for sale

Buy an apartment and get free food for a year

Exclusive look inside $60m Point Piper home

Ray White — Newtown agent Greg Haimandos said most of the interest so far has come from first home buyers and a handful of investors.

“We’ve had more than 25 groups through after one open, with a huge turnout from young buyers keen to get a foot into the market,” he said.

The property is owned by investors from Victoria, who last rented the dwelling out in June 2018 for $475 per week, according to CoreLogic.

Mr Haimandos said while it was one of the skinniest homes he had seen, many buyers have been surprised after stepping inside.

“The property is longer and more deep than what many were expecting,” he said.

“It is rare to find a property like this, there would only be a handful like it around this part of Sydney.”

The 95sqm block has 47.5sqm of internal living, with the front door a gateway to the living room, which flows into the bedroom and kitchen behind it. The rear has a bathroom and laundry that leads to the courtyard.

The terrace is so skinny that a Fiat 500 is more than a metre longer than the width of this property. The house also has no hallways due to its size.

Mr Haimandos said while feedback has been positive, buyers have made a few remarks about the bedroom.

“Some buyers have said the bedroom feels like a hallway because of its size,” he said.

Underneath the main home is a basement stretching along most of its length, which is currently used for storage. There is also another storage room at the rear of the property that could be turned into a studio or second bedroom.

“There is scope to extend the property into the under house storage,” he said.

The terrace has no price guide at this early stage, with Mr Haimandos noting it had been hard to find comparable sales for property like it.

Skinny homes are not uncommon in Sydney. During the property boom in 2015, a narrow house in a back alleyway of Surry Hills sold for $965,000 — $250,000 above the price guide. No. 29 Terry St had a width of only 2.85m and a land size of 38sqm.

An auction for the London St property will be held on October 31 at Ray White Newtown auction rooms.

description: A house in Enmore up for sale might just be Sydney’s skinniest home, with it so small that even a parked Fiat 500 out the front would dwarf it.
